q: What is Campus Mart?
a: Campus Mart is a campus-focused marketplace connecting students and vendors for food, products, and services.

q: How do I create an account?
a: Click Register, enter your details, and verify via email OTP if prompted.

q: I can’t log in, what should I do?
a: Use the Sign in with OTP option on the login page to receive a one-time code by email. If issues persist, contact support.

q: How do I update my profile?
a: Open Profile from the navbar, edit your name, bio, and photo, then save.

q: How do I delete my account?
a: Please contact support to request account deletion. We’ll guide you through confirmation and data removal.

q: How do I place an order?
a: Go to Marketplace or a Vendor page, add items to cart, then proceed to checkout from the Cart page.

q: Where can I track my orders?
a: Open the Orders page from the navbar after logging in to view order status and history.

q: Can I cancel an order?
a: Orders can be canceled before the vendor starts preparing. Go to Orders, select the order, and choose Cancel if available.

q: How do refunds work?
a: If an order is canceled or fails, refunds are initiated immediately. Depending on your payment method, funds may take 3–7 business days to reflect.

q: My delivery is late
a: Open Orders to check live status. If it’s significantly delayed, contact the vendor from the order details or reach support for help.

q: I haven’t received my order
a: Check Orders for status and vendor contact. If marked delivered but not received, contact support and we’ll investigate with the vendor.

q: What payment methods do you accept?
a: We support common digital payments. If a method fails, try another option or contact your bank.

q: My payment failed but was charged
a: Occasionally banks place a temporary hold. It usually auto-reverses within 3–7 business days. Contact support with the transaction ID if it does not.

q: How do I become a vendor?
a: Go to the Become Vendor page in your profile or vendor section, submit your business details, and an admin will review your request.

q: How long does vendor approval take?
a: Approvals typically take 1–3 business days after you submit your application.

q: How do I edit my shop photo?
a: Open Vendor Dashboard and click Change Photo in the shop header to upload a new image.

q: How do I edit my vendor bio?
a: Open Vendor Dashboard and edit the Bio field in your shop header. Save to update immediately.

q: How do I update business details (name, type, location)?
a: From Vendor Dashboard, update your business name, type, and location in vendor settings. These sync to your public shop.

q: How do I add or manage products?
a: From Vendor Dashboard, go to Products to add items, set price, images, and availability.

q: What are vendor fees or commissions?
a: Platform fees may apply per transaction. Check your Vendor Dashboard or your agreement for the current rate.

q: How do I browse vendors?
a: Open Vendors to see shops. Click any vendor to view their products and details.

q: How do I use filters in marketplace?
a: Use search and category filters on Marketplace to narrow down items by type, price, or vendor.

q: Do you have ratings and reviews?
a: Ratings and reviews may be shown on vendor pages when available.

q: Can I pick up instead of delivery?
a: Pickup availability depends on the vendor. Check the vendor’s page or product details for pickup options.

q: How do I contact a vendor?
a: Open the vendor’s store page. If messaging is available, you’ll see a Contact or Message button; otherwise, use order notes and support.

q: What are vendor operating hours?
a: Hours vary by vendor. Check the vendor’s store page for latest timings if provided.

q: I see wrong information on a vendor page
a: Please report it via support with the vendor name, and we’ll notify the vendor to correct it.

q: Which campuses or locations are supported?
a: We serve selected campuses. Availability and delivery zones appear within Marketplace and vendor pages based on your profile.

q: What is your return or cancellation policy?
a: Food and perishable items generally cannot be returned. Orders can be canceled before preparation starts. For other items, see the item’s return policy if provided.

q: What items are prohibited?
a: Vendors must comply with campus and legal policies. Hazardous or restricted items are not allowed.

q: How is my data used?
a: We only use your data to operate the service and improve your experience. See the privacy policy for details.

q: The app is slow or not loading
a: Try refreshing, logging out and back in, or clearing browser cache. If the issue persists, contact support with a screenshot.

q: How do I reach support?
a: Use the chat widget at the bottom right or email support. Provide your order ID for faster help.
